title: Martin Pearson
text:
Martin Pearson (), also known by the nickname of "Pee Wee", is a former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> and <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer who played in the 1990s and 2000s. He played representative level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a>, and at club level for the <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Featherstone%20Rovers%20players">Heritage №</a>), <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax</a> (two spells), the <a href="Sheffield%20Eagles">Sheffield Eagles</a> and the <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity Wildcats</a>, as a <a href="Goal%20%28sports%29%23Rugby%20football">goal</a>-kicking , or , and club level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Section%20Paloise">Section Paloise (Pau RUFC)</a>.
Playing career.
International honours.
Martin Pearson won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> (RL) while at Sheffield Eagles, and Wakefield Trinity Wildcats 1996(1998?)…2001 3(4, 5?)-caps + 1-cap (<a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a>) 2-tries 2-goals 12-points.
Division Two Premiership Final appearances.
Martin Pearson played and scored four <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">conversion</a>s in <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>' 20-16 victory over <a href="Workington%20Town">Workington Town</a> in the <a href="1992%E2%80%9393%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1992–93</a> <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship%20Second%20Division">Division Two Premiership</a> Final at <a href="Old%20Trafford">Old Trafford</a>, <a href="Manchester">Manchester</a> on Wednesday 19 May 1993.
Career Records.
Martin Pearson holds <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>' 'The Most Points In A Season' record, with 391-points scored in the <a href="1992%E2%80%9393%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1992–93 season</a>.
